'''Poipole''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ベベノム''' ''Bebenomu'') is a {{type|Poison}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VII]] in [[Pokémon Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Naganadel}} when [[Level|leveled]] up while knowing {{m|Dragon Pulse}}.

It is one of the [[Ultra Beast]]s and is known by the code name '''UB Adhesive''' (Japanese: '''{{tt|ＵＢ：ＳＴＩＣＫＹ|ユービー：スティッキー}}''' ''UB: Sticky'').

==Biology==
Poipole is a small purple Pokémon with a large head and small limbs with no visible digits. It has a long tail with a small spike on it, giving it a vaguely reptilian appearance. The tip of its tail, chest, face and tips of its head spikes are fuchsia. On its head are three spikes. The side spikes and the top of its head have grey nozzles which are capable of firing a glowing adhesive poison. It laughs while targeting opponents with this poison. Poipole's eyes and mouth give off a cyan glow.

Poipole originates from [[Ultra Megalopolis]] in [[Ultra Space]], where it is popular as a [[starter Pokémon]]. Poipole is capable of understanding human speech after spending enough time with humans<ref>https://www.pokemon-sunmoon.com/ultra/en-us/gallery-detail-5.html</ref>.

Poipole debuted in [[SM055]], where it was traversing an [[Ultra Wormhole]]. It reappeared in [[SM061]].

==Trivia==
* Poipole and its {{p|Naganadel|evolution}} are the only [[Ultra Beast]]s that are part of an evolutionary line.
* Poipole has the lowest base stat total of all the Ultra Beasts.
* Poipole and its evolution were created by [[James Turner]].
* Poipole shares its {{pkmn|category}} name with its {{p|Naganadel|evolution}}, {{p|Nidoran♀}}, {{p|Nidorina}}, {{p|Nidoran♂}}, and {{p|Nidorino}}. They are all known as the Poison Pin Pokémon.

===Origin===
Poiple appears to be the infant of a stereotypical alien. Considering its evolution line, Poiple might also be based on the larva of a wasp.

====Name origin====
Poipole is a combination of ''poison'' and ''pole''<ref>[https://twitter.com/JamesTurner_42/status/931788320752918529 Twitter - James Turner confirming name origin]</ref>. It is also a play on ''purple''.

Bebenomu is a combination of ''baby'' or ''bébé'' (French for baby) and ''venom''<ref>[https://twitter.com/JamesTurner_42/status/931665326772645888 Twitter - James Turner revealing Japanese name origin]</ref>.
